marklogic.body: One of the places I was stationed at during my 6 year service in the U.S. Navy was the last and outer most Aleutian Island called Attu. I was stationed there for 13 months.We actually used the wooden cabins where we fished on the north side of Attu that were built by the Japanese in World War II.The Naval Security Detachment and Weather Station was located on the south side of the Island of Attu. Much of the year we experienced 65 degrees below zero weather. In the spring, around April, the snow began to melt which made it possible to climb over the mountain which stretched out from the east to the west at a place called "jackass pass." We often stayed in the Japanese cabins for 3 or 4 days and caught a load of trout and salmon in the very clear streams and river. I used salmon eggs to catch trout that were swimming right through our legs as we stood in the crystal clear streams. We went back over the pass with the fish packed in ice in our back packs and took them to the station cook's galley to cook fresh and ate it while drinking a few beers and watching the same movie over and over for at least 30 days until a Navy PBY plane could get through the bitter Cold snow packed weather to bring us a new movie to watch another 30 days or so and brought us our personal mail that was sent to us from our parents. Once a month the Coast Guard was able to dock their ship on the south side of the island where they (and we) unloaded 200 cases of beer.We found an old bowling lane and used it for the top of our beer bar. Beer cost 5 cents a bottle and cigarettes were one dollar a carton. (10 packs).There were about 20 sailors stationed on the island, with rotation around every 12 months.Because of the extreme harsh winters, it was very difficult to fly in a replacement for us. Everyone had their own calendar to mark the days spent on this assignment. After serving on the island for 11 months you were labeled as a "short timer." When you returned to the states at Whidbey Island in Puget Sound near Seattle,Washington, guys got Off the plane and kissed the ground!
